text: ♪ The Ghost And Molly McGee ♪

Brighton. Some have said we were
the original windy city--

till some bigger city bullied us
out of the name.
Darryl: Wind.

So when it comes
to wind turbines,

you can say
we are big fans.
That's right.

We love our wind
here in Brighton.
( clears throat )
I said, we love wind.

- Scratch: Oh, yeah.
- ( yelling )
Oh, it's so nice and windy.
Wind.

We may not have
super fast internet
or fancy corporate tax breaks,

but we're a great town
with even greater people.
I said no magic! Sorry.

This town is usually
magician-free, guaranteed.
Go away, Irving.
Wind.

We've also got
a gently-used factory,

so you'll save big money
on construction.

Brighton,
make your wind turbines here
and life will be a breeze.
( wind howling )

I can't believe our
video campaign actually worked.
Credit to you, Molly.

You are bringing jobs
back to Brighton.

What about me?
I wasn't even paid

for my very
important role of wind.

Oh, I told you,
you get paid in hugs.

You're going to squeeze
some wind out of me,

you keep this up.
( farts )

Well, that's called
too late now, isn't it?

Okay, we'll just call it
a group effort.

And now we've got
a whole day of celebration.

Factory ribbon cutting at 10,
then the parade,
then the ice cream social.
Parade, candy, and ice cream?

Let me just clear my schedule
and, viola!

It was already empty.
Who knew?
What? What? No!

Why do they always call
when I'm about to have fun?

Be back in time to power
the wind float!

Scratch,
are you even scaring anyone
in the land of the living?

Of course.
Check my scare reports.

It's all there
in black and white,

and sometimes
a little bit of mustard.

Then why is Brighton
no longer miserable?

It's teetering
dangerously close to joy.

There must be
someone spreading

happiness and hope
in Brighton.

Yes, a joy agent.
Any ideas who?

- ( music playing ) 
- ( no audible dialogue )
( music continues )
A joy agent?

( chuckles )
Oh, that's-- ha!

There's no joy agent.
That's crazy.

- Probably a blip.
- Enough!
The chairman is displeased.
We've assigned a joy hunter
to get to the bottom of this.

Hey. Scratch, is it?
Jinx. Hi.

Look, I want you
to just chill,

breathe deep,
and center yourself.

Because together,
me and you, you and I,

we are going
to get to the bottom
of this whole joy thing.

Jinx is our most ruthless
joy hunter.

It's true. I don't want
to get all braggy and all,

- but I always find my joy.
- Oh, good.

We're going to have
some fun then.
Do not sweat this, big guy.

We'll get your town back in
a miserable state in no time.

Yeah, great.
I'd love to wrap this up asap.

Though I'm still not sure
there's any joy here, so...
Wow! What a glorious day!

Hey, you know what?
I know just the place

to start looking
for that joy.
What? Where are you going?

You're going to miss
the ribbon cutting.
